intro: Cyananthus longiflorus, commonly known as the long-flowered bluebell, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in loose clusters and are known for their delicate, bell-shaped appearance. Cyananthus longiflorus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories.
